website_summaries.verdict: Available in multiple colors, this responsive smart light switch can be controlled via a handy smartphone app.
pros: Pairing is quick and easy and results in a reliable connection with the mobile app
LED lights on switch conveniently let you know what mode it's in
cons: Pricey option if you want to buy several
Lacks option for random lighting patterns

customer_reviews.title: Insteon lasts about 3 years, attached are 4 I removed this week.
customer_reviews.text: The wall switches were working fine for 2-3 years and then we started having issues controlling them remotely and such. In the photo, these 3 went bad in the same 3-gang switch and got changed out to Wi-Fi today. The 3 thermostat controllers are still working fine so I will keep the 3rd replacement hub working until they start failing. I would recommend these as long as you are willing to swap them our starting after 2-3 years but the loss of control was something I could not overcome even with 5 range extenders for some reason.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: They don't last long
customer_reviews.text: I really like the functionality of the Insteon switches, especially when used in conjunction with the 8 key keypad switches and/or Home Automation. However, all Insteon products contain cheap capacitors, and there's a long running very well known problem with Insteon switches starting to fail right after two years have gone by. Some of mine last way longer. But in the end, they all seem to eventually fail. I wish Insteon would get its act together and start using better quality capacitors.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Riley

customer_reviews.title: Nice switches that work great with Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality switches that look and feel nice. The LED position indicator is nice and helps you find the switches at night. Hooked up to an Insteon Hub with about 40 other devices. Nice iPhone app to control the house. Insteon works great with Amazon Echo. Now have scenes controlling multiple lights and devices like "Alexa turn on evening" that turns the family room lights at a nice tv viewing level and turns the gas fireplace on.
customer_reviews.author: Knit

customer_reviews.title: If Only They Would Last!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased enough of these expensive Insteon Dimmer switches over the years to outfit my whole house where appropriate. The switches work great and the technology is wonderful. However, they only last a year or two before becoming inoperative. The manufacturer is certainly aware of this built-in obsolescence because he pushes an expensive extended warranty. If only these dimmers were manufactured with quality components, or they came with a 5 year warranty, I would consider them to be excellent. Until then, prepare to replace them often. Not a very cost-effective expenditure.
customer_reviews.author: Red Barron

customer_reviews.title: Switch is good; APP is unacceptably terrible
customer_reviews.text: Don’t pay any attention to the negative reviews. I am not an electrician and installed 35+ Insteon switches and outlets in my 18 year old home. The hub fritzed out after 22 months. Replaced at no cost. The hardwired switches and outlets perform flawlessly and without a single problem in 3+ years. The battery operated products (motion sensor and leak detector) are difficult to set up and troubleshoot. My only real complaint is that the iOS app is just awful. It takes forever to load or refresh; it has also not been improved in more than three years of ownership. Come on, Insteon!!! Unless you’re dealing with some bizarre wiring issue, these products are easy to install and use.
customer_reviews.author: Deb & Paul

customer_reviews.title: 1st attempt - was sent wrong switch, 2nd attempt (replacement) was not working
customer_reviews.text: Really, 1st attempt - was sent wrong switch, 2nd attempt (replacement) switch would not work. Worked fine from software (HCA) app, but physically the switch would not toggle lights. Been long time INSTEON user, noticed the quality of switches appears to have gotten worse :-( Yes, tried factory resetting switch multiple times. Oh, yea, I'm an electrical engineer - so pretty sure it's installed correctly, besides, have installed dozens in my house over the last decade and only recently started having issues with Insteon hardware :-(
customer_reviews.author: DYankee

customer_reviews.title: For use with incandescent bulbs - lol
customer_reviews.text: I totally missed this in the description. My bad. However, this is 2019 and where does one even buy an incandescent bulb? I would have never expected that a new dimmer switch that is compatible with Alexa, should not be compatible with LED bulbs. —> “not compatible with LED or CFL bulbs”
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Ellen

customer_reviews.title: Dual communication channels make these things very reliable.
customer_reviews.text: This particular model is a strictly on off device. It is used in our workshop control the main LED lights. One of the nice features of these is that it sends a specific signal to the controller when these switches are manually actuated, either turned on or off. That allows the controller to determine if someone left the lights on, when they are not supposed to be on, like after working hours. That signal can then be used to turn the lights off remotely. The on-off event is also logged to allow determination of when the last worker left if they remembered to turn the lights off.
customer_reviews.author: Armin A. Wolff

customer_reviews.title: Terrible?! Who needs separate hubs?!!
customer_reviews.text: I wish the description was a little bit more accurate, I mean did you say that you need their hub but it’s a little bit misleading when you’re reading a long description it says I will Alexa Compatible. I have to send the stupid thing back now, who wants to pay $50 for a smart switch when most of them cost half that plus you have to buy a $70 hub, are you kidding me? What a rip off! Almost everything on the market works directly with Amazon Alexa, so stupid. I would not recommend this product at all! I’m still looking for a smart switch that does not require a neutral wire ughhh
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Be prepared for a hassle if you install yourself, ...
customer_reviews.text: Be prepared for a hassle if you install yourself, because of wiring differences. You will very likely need to call support for help. An electrician who knows the product (and not all do) can do the installation, but it will cost a lot more than the switches. I installed 8 of these switches myself. One has already failed in less than a year. I am trying to get a replacement but Insteon is giving me a hassle. I wish I had never bought these things in the first place.
customer_reviews.author: RP

customer_reviews.title: No Alexa without hub?
customer_reviews.text: Just received today. It installed fine and the On/Off/Dimmer manually work fine (one day's worth, at this point). It appears that the dimmer will only work with Alexa, if you buy or already have the Insteon hub as well. That was not particularly clear in the descriptions nor in the Q&As. I have several Alexa controlled plugs that worked quite well without any additional hub. Expected the same here - it appears to be an oversight on my part (not getting the hub). I have now ordered the hub. Hope it lasts longer than some have experienced.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Jones

customer_reviews.title: Best tech available for consumer-grade
customer_reviews.text: I've installed about 50 Insteon devices in my home over the last 10 years. This is hands down the most reliable, flexible, and responsive consumer-friendly home automation technology available. The devices respond instantaneously when configured in a peer to peer mesh and with only a slight delay when paired with an automation hub. Integration with Alexa works fine, but Google is a bit better. No hardware failures experienced so far with any of the Insteon devices I have purchased.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice dimmer, but doesn't work with LED bulbs
customer_reviews.text: Nice dimmer, but doesn't work with LED bulbs. Says that in the manual after we installed it - light stays on even in lowest setting. Who is using old style bulbs today with new dimmers and Alexa?
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about Insteon. The devices work but the build quality is pretty cheap. Quite frequently I tap and the units don't respond. You have to 'press with intent'. Customer support is the worst. They have never even heard of some of their own products and were unable to help me with any of my issues. In fact e-mail requests were simply ignored. Luckily there is a decent community out there that knows the product quite well and are helpful. They are also well aware of the awful customer support.
customer_reviews.author: N2HIFI

customer_reviews.title: Amazing value and functionalities!
customer_reviews.text: It has been six month that we installed insteon throughout the house and I couldn’t be more happy with it ! It works almost flawlessly. All of the addons connected right away. The app never crashed. It is pretty amazing. The buttons are very stylish and not more expensive than a regular dimmer switch. I would totally order it again if I had to. I am surprised that insteon is not more popular....
customer_reviews.author: AYB

customer_reviews.title: Pay attention and read everything when ordering anything
customer_reviews.text: Read the description carefully! It's only an On-Off switch; not a dimmer like the picture of the product alludes to. 2477DLAL is the dimmer version. I did call Insteon and they said they use the same exterior plastic housing for both the dimmer and the plain on-off switch. I realize I could send this back and get the correct on, but this is all on me for not paying attention in the first place. A picture says a thousand words, and I bit. $45 ouch!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Owing to its redundant communication design, Insteon is the most robust automation product line available for DIY installations. My home incorporates an Insteon Hub and over forty switches, plugs, and plug ins, forming a robust web of interconnected devices. It works flawlessly and easily with Alexa, and I’ve never had a device fail.
customer_reviews.author: DrJB

customer_reviews.title: Dimmable LEDs flicker
customer_reviews.text: Insteon devices communicate with the base over the power lines (Ethernet Over Power) and my dimmable LEDs that are connected to one of these dimmers flicker when the base station is sending/receiving data.
customer_reviews.author: possibly_burrito

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for home automation
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 4 of these to start my home automation project. One was used to replace single switch and the other three were used in a four-way application. The supplied instructions were clear and easy to follow, especially when it came to replacing the three switches used in the 4-way setup. The switches fit nicely in the existing boxes, even when ganged in a double box. The switches have a quality feel and look great with my existing wood covers. Setup of the three switches used in the 4-way group was straight forward as was the integration with the Amazon Echo and Insteon Hub.
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmeri

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. The toughest part is figuring out which ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy install. The toughest part is figuring out which wire color (black or red) to connect to high wire in my switch box (white or black). Easily added the switch on the Insteon app (manually issuing the code on the switch). Also purchased a hub so i could use Alexa to control the dimmer. The hub installation was also easy as could be. Whole thing was up and running including adding Alexa voice control in less than an hour. Was a little scared by the reviews regarding installation of the hub and switch but it all worked like a charm.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher T.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time
customer_reviews.text: I've had a simple Insteon system with ISY 994i for four years now. It has to be the most unreliable and overall flaky system I've ever owned. I've fairly tech savvy having worked professionally in the networking field for many years. But life is just too short to continually have to mess with this very poor, slow and unreliable system. So after four years, I've decided to tear it out and sell it on eBay.
customer_reviews.author: Reader

customer_reviews.title: and were easy to pair
customer_reviews.text: Pair these with an ISY Universal Devices and ELK m1 panel. switches work very well. tying the lighting to the elk is very handy. We set the system to turn off all common area lighting whenever the system is armed, and to activate lighting upon disarm. The switches work well, they are responsive, and were easy to pair . Only down side my be : you mush have a natural line at the switch. Not all homes / businesses are wired this way. You can cheat and hook the neutral to ground, but that's not code. also not the manufacturer's fault to know how your home is wired.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Zarett

customer_reviews.title: High quality switches that look and feel nice and work great with Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: These are high quality switches that look and feel nice. The LED position indicator is nice and helps you find the switches at night. Hooked up to an Insteon Hub with about 40 other devices. Nice iPhone app to control the house. Insteon works great with Amazon Echo. Now have scenes controlling multiple lights and devices like "Alexa turn on evening" that turns the family room lights at a nice tv viewing level and turns the gas fireplace on.
customer_reviews.author: Knit

customer_reviews.title: Insteon is great, easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I have over 30 insteon devices. So far they work as expected and setting up with hub has been pretty easy. I started without a hub and manual linking but with a lot of devices it becomes tedious. Currently using insteon with Stringify to control temperature based automations for an outdoor pond heater and pump. All of the central light switches in my house are now insteon and controlled via Alexa and scenes. Waiting on insteon to release a vacancy sensor to replace some bedroom switches or will upgrade to Indigo for more complex automation. So far so good with insteon.
customer_reviews.author: Denver Photog

customer_reviews.title: Pay Attention! Need the bridge!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item without paying enough attention to the description. You must have the Insteon bridge to use this. I immediately returned it without installing as I have no desire to purchase the needed bridge. Went with Levitron. Was only $4 more per unit (at the time) and didn't require the $80 bridge.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Kiser

customer_reviews.title: Works well with just a few hiccups...
customer_reviews.text: Works well seems to have a little problem interacting with the insteon hub on occasion. Some of the on dim settings from the app and hub don't seem to work all the time and it can't remember the on dim settings with amazon echo at all that I can tell... Haven't played with it in a while so it may have had some updates and the problem is fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: Missing Switch Plate (DELIBERATE MISDIRECTION)
customer_reviews.text: There is NO Switch Plate enclosed, and it is deliberate MISLEADING. Nowhere on the product description does it say there is NO switch plate included. If you look at the picture it shows it WITH a switch plate. If you scroll down to the installation instructions (or read the included installation instruction), Step 5 shows the installation of the wall plate. It does NOT say that this is purchased separately. So now we have to spend another $7 to buy the Switch Plate. So to me it's a patent deliberate misleading of customers.
customer_reviews.author: Smiling, as Usual

customer_reviews.title: Insteon remote dimmer switch review
customer_reviews.text: The switch is great to use remotely. Only issue is that after several months of use the lights have started to flicker occasionally. I suspect it is wearing out, will report back if it breaks. I am using the halogen bulbs that look like regular incandescent bulbs. The bulb wattage is within the switch spec but perhaps running it close wears it down. I did try some low wattage led bulbs but same flickering. Using the Amazon Echo to control the light using voice commands is really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: No Responce with HomeKit
customer_reviews.text: I replaced all my light switches with Insteon 2-Wire dimmers. I bought the Insteon Homekit hub everything worked fine for awhile. Recently, (last couple months) I get a “no response” in HomeKit. I have contacted Insteon support and they have no clue for a fix. So now I am having to just use manual operation of all my dimmers. Very expensive dimmer switches and will not work over Wi-Fi.
customer_reviews.author: Rjgroves

customer_reviews.title: Only works with incandescent lights!
customer_reviews.text: It needs a big warning label that only works with incandescent lights! Also can not get it to connect to the hub and the only help seems to be by phone and they are only open during the week.
customer_reviews.author: Martin Brossman

customer_reviews.title: No more manual turning on/off outside lights
customer_reviews.text: We no longer worry about turning our outside lights on or off. To set time, we are using a PC software that is no longer supported by Insteon -- don't know why but can only speculate -- which allows us to set time at sunset and sunrise instead of specifying time in GMT. Specifying time in GMT require seasonal adjustments, which is a hassle.
customer_reviews.author: KaizanRaiden

customer_reviews.title: Beware of buying these refursbished.
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several of these Insteon 2Wire switches (some new) and these two refurbished ones. The refurbished ones worked fine initially but then after a couple of weeks they stopped working properly (lights would pulse and then switch just died). By the time I got around to replacing them with new ones and processing a return etc through Amazon the 30 day return window had expired. Amazon should really look into extending the return window for refurbished electronics like these. Overall I like the product, just not the refurbished ones. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Alyson

customer_reviews.title: Great addition for a smart home and super tech support
customer_reviews.text: In a big house this is a big help. Easy to define scenes and if I am late in coming home, I can turn the lights on for my puppies. before walking in basement I can lit up part or all of the basement. automated the outdoor lights with a program.
customer_reviews.author: Ajay

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 88 Insteon 2477D switches for a new home. Every switch has been installed and they have all worked without any problems. I have programmed a number of them for 2, 3 and 5 way lighting. They are all working as designed. The system has been up and running for 3 weeks now without any failures or any DOA switches. I would not have been surprised to get a couple DOA or early failures given the number of switches I have, but so far I have not lost a single one. I think that shows pretty good quality control. Things could always change down the road, but I am happy with the purchase so far.
customer_reviews.author: ND96

customer_reviews.title: INSTEON is Amazing !!!
customer_reviews.text: I chose to go with INSTEON due to the fact they have great products and support Windows and Windows Phone. I am very happy with this switch. I got it for my front porch so I can set a schedule to turn on the lights every night and turn off every morning. Now I don't have to remember to do it my self. I am no electrician, but Installation is pretty simple. I have installed a few of these throughout my home and it is a pretty simple task. Just be sure to follow the instructions that are included in the packaging.
customer_reviews.author: David Perez

customer_reviews.title: My parents have a fairly extensive insteon network in their ...
customer_reviews.text: My parents have a fairly extensive insteon network in their home. many indoor and outdoor lights are controlled by insteon switches and dimmers. The pool pump and an outdoor fan are controlled by heavy insteon controllers. The devices are reliable, attractive, and convenient. The windows app for the hub (when using surface tablets, windows 10, and windows phone) is buggy, so I hope they improve that in the future.
customer_reviews.author: S. Harward

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck if you're a do-it-yourself automation hobbyist.
customer_reviews.text: Insteon is a great product if you are a DIY automation hobbyist. I originally looked at Control4, Crestron, and others, and the proprietary nature of the systems lock you into programmers and consultants. Insteon gives great reliability (100+ switches for 10 years and had 3 go bad). I control everything with Indigo on imac, and because it's programmable I can add devices, change schedules, etc. without paying fees or waiting for appointments from the installer. Bang for the buck you can't go wrong (but it does require a love of automation and logic to really get the most out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Brad Clayton

customer_reviews.title: These work excellent in our home automation setup
customer_reviews.text: These work excellent in our home automation setup. They can be a bit tricky to fit into existing installations due to the larger size as compared to standard light switches. Be sure to check for enough room in the junction box.
customer_reviews.author: J. Heddings

customer_reviews.title: Works with LED if there are enough of them on circuit.  Needs hub to be controlled by Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Works with my 6 LED cam lights (10 x 6 = 60 totally watts). Happy that it works without the neutral wire. Only drawback was that I also had to buy the insteon hub for to it to work remotely, but there were no other options for my 2 wire setup.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli H

customer_reviews.title: Works great w/ Echo!
customer_reviews.text: Some folks are dinging these for price, and I totally get that. However, this is a solid piece of tech built inside a UL approved switch, providing convenience and reliable wireless connectability. If you are buying devices like this, technically, you're an early adopter in home automation, so what do you expect? Is it worth $40+? Depends on your definition of value and if your a gadget/tech geek...which I am. Anyways, easy to install, good documentation, simple to connect, and so far, no issues at all.
customer_reviews.author: USERBOSCO

customer_reviews.title: Works well on older circuits
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a basement area that had only switched hot side. Works as should, response well over AC line only, no issues. Must use with incandescent bulbs only!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck B.

customer_reviews.title: works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: works perfectly with my Smartlinc Insteon Hub. installed right away after I received it and still working until now (4yrs). I can control my light switch even I am not at home. perfect pair with my home IP camera because IR is not that good. switch is kind a bulky at the back son installation will be a little bit tricky if you have a box with so many wires to fold. it fits 2 of this switch in a 2-gang had to push a little to cramp the wires at the back. very very satisfied and I will buy more to expand my system.
customer_reviews.author: Neil_Vals

customer_reviews.title: Working well
customer_reviews.text: I have 10 of these and they have been installed over the last year. No failures and they are spread over 3 floors. Previously had X-10 system for decades but old age, signal loss and noise due to TV's and computer finally made X-10 unreliable. I'm sure the RF mesh is what keeps the Insteons working. Also have the hub, mini-remote and two plug-in adapters. Note these will not respond to X-10.
customer_reviews.author: David Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Great lighting control.
customer_reviews.text: The Insteon system is wonderful, this unit is a dimmer switch, so it needs a dimmable load, like incandescent bulbs. There are reports of flickering when used with other so-called dimmable bulbs (LED and CFL). This model is limited to small loads, so I had to buy the High wattage version for my chandeliers and master bath lights (10 x 100 watt bulbs each), even after I replace those with lower wattage lights. I use these with an ISY 994i controller that vastly improves the usability of all Insteon devices.
customer_reviews.author: xyz

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install except as a 3 way application
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these installed and so far they work well. My only complaint is that they are very complicated to install in a 3 way application. One of my electrical boxes didn't have a neutral wire (white wire). After trying everything I could think of, I finally have to connect the neutral switch wire to ground to get the switch to work. I don't know why, but this is not within code and may reduce the life of the switch. Also, you need two switches for the three way application. Linking two switches together doesn't always work the first try either.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A Powelson

customer_reviews.title: The challenge with this device is that you need the neutral wire present in the switch box to make this work which fortunately I
customer_reviews.text: Had an older model of wireless motion sensor on the back door. It died and I was able to replace it with this one. The challenge with this device is that you need the neutral wire present in the switch box to make this work which fortunately I did. Many switches are not wired with the neutral in the switch box thus this switch could be an additional challenge. For me, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: cestgrp

customer_reviews.title: NA
customer_reviews.text: IT works great, So far so good. However, I read reviews that indicated that I may have operational problems after a few years. I will be monitoring it.
customer_reviews.author: don

customer_reviews.title: ... a half dozen of these now and they work great. Easy to install if you know how to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have installed a half dozen of these now and they work great. Easy to install if you know how to install a switch or outlet. Programming is also easy. Only drawback (with Insteon in general) is that you need a few devices installed for any of them to work. When I started, I installed one switch and it absolutely would not work because I did not have a "robust" network. You really need to start with at least 3 devices, preferably more. I learned this from exploring user groups, not from Insteon customer service who thought I had a defective switch!
customer_reviews.author: jmorgans

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Fairly simple to install, haven't tried 2-way/3-way switch installation, but wiring instruction diagram is straight forward. Requires hot, load and neutral wires. Have to pull some neutral wires to some of my switches, not too difficult because have electricians in the family that taught me proper ways to work with residential electric. Switch communicates fast with smartphone app and computer program. Programming certain features seemed complicated,[...] or[...] have videos and PDF files that help. I think the switch is a little overpriced. Amazon is cheapest so far, about $10 off compared to other sites. 6 pack of switches doesn't offer any real savings than buying them individually.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Insteon element
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these. They are amazing. I have more than a dozen Insteon devices and their hub and use my iPhone for monitoring, programming and turning things on an off. Works like a champ. Easy to install. Great product support via phone.
customer_reviews.author: Michaelby

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install was just what I needed for older ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install was just what I needed for older style wiring system "striate leg" it' call but was no told to work with Alexa I also needed to have a Insteon HUB. That delay me having to make use of them until I got the HUB after hook right up with support help and work great with Alexa and Google.
customer_reviews.author: Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Such great home automation!  Love these switches!
customer_reviews.text: I love Insteon! I’m slowly replacing all the switches in my house. I love the old pump system I’m about halfway through the switch is my main living area. I also installed in the wall dimmer switch is behind outlets to control my undercabinet lighting. It’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Chris R.

customer_reviews.title: Can be temperamental
customer_reviews.text: I bought a grand total of four and have one location where it is sensed but won't register with the hub. I've tried each of the switches there, and all have the same problem in that location. Funny as it is a very short run from working switches and less than 20 from the service entrance. I need to put more time into figuring it out. Insteon tech support has never returned a call nor have I been able to get through to a human.
customer_reviews.author: irish-george

customer_reviews.title: Works great but...
customer_reviews.text: We had to connect the wires opposite from the way it is described in instructions. And back of switch was too large for my gang box. Had to buy a gang box extender and a face plate. In all this set up was more expensive than I expected. Not sure I can afford to do this to other switches in my home.
customer_reviews.author: Lat

customer_reviews.title: They don't last forever.
customer_reviews.text: Insteon products are generally solid and reliable, until they abruptly die. They do appear to be getting better over time. My house is controlled by over 30 insteon devices, controlled by an ISY994, with assistance from Alexa. Having to replace something every three or four months isn't too bad. But it could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: A lot more then a light swtch
customer_reviews.text: I was having weird X10 problems. Some of the weirdness I just learned to live with untill I installed this switch. My main problem for using this switch was to correct an issue with LED bulbs. The X10 switch just did not work well with LED bulbs. This works fantastic. As far as weird problems go, like lights not turning on and off, not dimming correctly, etc., this switch corrected those issues too. Yes, other X10 modules with different unit codes work great now. I understand it has a repeater in it. Very easy to program and is a great upgrade to X10.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Switches have been generally easy to work with
customer_reviews.text: Switches have been generally easy to work with, easy to set up, and generally as described. However, I'm giving it 4 stars as it wasn't made clear in any of the Insteon material that the switch needs a 3-wire setup (line/ load/ common). If you have older wiring, then you may have to get a different model switch that is made for the older 2-wire setups in older houses.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn S

customer_reviews.title: Love this! conects really easy
customer_reviews.text: Love this! conects really easy. Doesnt make a loud click when turned on or off. I used to have X10 stuff that would click really loud. I think it was the relay inside that made the noise. These are great and quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Insteon to the Rescue
customer_reviews.text: I had a situation where I wanted to separate lights controlled by two separate wall switches to operate in concert. Was looking at ripping apart walls and ceiling to change wiring when Insteon came to the rescue. Simply replaced both switches with these Insteon switches, linked them together, and voila, a "magic" 3-way switch system with both lights controlled in unison by either switch!
customer_reviews.author: jrogersmn

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: worked for a week or so.. then died .. useless garbage
customer_reviews.author: Mr Furf

customer_reviews.title: The app is not pretty, and it can be hard to setup
customer_reviews.text: The nicest hardware for remotely connected switches I have come across. The app is not pretty, and it can be hard to setup, but once it's done it's worth it. I just hope the introduce Google home support soon. I use the homeboy app to control them, much nicer then the insteon app. Lots of tmdifferent hardware options, scheduling, scenes and all sorts of other things. High quality, and highly configurable.
customer_reviews.author: William Houston

customer_reviews.title: The app is not pretty, and it can be hard to setup
customer_reviews.text: The nicest hardware for remotely connected switches I have come across. The app is not pretty, and it can be hard to setup, but once it's done it's worth it. I just hope the introduce Google home support soon. I use the homeboy app to control them, much nicer then the insteon app. Lots of tmdifferent hardware options, scheduling, scenes and all sorts of other things. High quality, and highly configurable.
customer_reviews.author: William Houston

customer_reviews.title: This unit works well, not sure about the hub!
customer_reviews.text: This unit works as advertised on our front porch light. I also purchased the Insteon on hub to go with it, even though it only had three stars, and it turns out that's more of a problem than this light switch. This light switch does work and I would buy another one next time I need one
customer_reviews.author: Greg Beroldi

customer_reviews.title: Works, just not with all bulbs
customer_reviews.text: This is a great dining switch if you are still using tungsten bulbs like no-one else.. this does not work with LED or Powersaving bulbs. These flicker and can only be "on", "very dim", and "off" which destroys the purpose of a variable dimmer really. Why these aren't compatible with new bulbs I really don't understand..
customer_reviews.author: Keith Durrant

customer_reviews.title: Add in the pretty easy ability to add a simple remote and it's ...
customer_reviews.text: If you use Insteon at all, then USE ALL YOUR MONIES AND PUT THESE SWITCHES ERRYWHERE. But seriously, even if you don't use Insteon, this dimmer beats a lot of non "smart" capable dimmers hands down. Add in the pretty easy ability to add a simple remote and it's a good value. If you're going to put a dimmer anyways, and you don't use or foresee yourself using ZWave home automation, then get this switch.
customer_reviews.author: David Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!!
customer_reviews.text: Does what is is supposed to. It is clean and crisp looking. Also from a scale of one to ten it is a 3 to install. Kudos Insteon. Now if I could just figure out port forwarding!!
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Insteon Rocks!
customer_reviews.text: I have a house full of Insteon switches, and could not get along without them. The neat part is that the switches can be tied together electronically, creating 3-way (or more) switches without special wiring. In addition to these dimmers, Insteon offers a plethora of products for automating the home. I've recently installed an Insteon "Hub," which allows insteon devices to be controlled from your smartphone or by a timer within the Hub.
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Dave

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a 2466SW with this one which is dual band. That is important.The single band didn't work but this one which is dual band worked perfectly. I installed it in a weather proof cover outside for my pool lights. Now can control from the living room panel. Very convenient. I had no problems installing it and making it work with my ISY-99.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Home Automation/Security
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 8 of these in order to have my dinning room, kitchen and family room overhead lights turn on and off, whether I am home or travelling. Additionally, since they are connected to a Revolv Hub, I can turn them on/off via my phone (iPhone) from anywhere, or anytime. They work with low voltage as well as with incandescent lighting (as I have both). Love them. Also allows balance as you can set the lighting level to be the same, yet adjust to emphasize lighting over pictures.
customer_reviews.author: T. R. Akin

customer_reviews.title: Love it, as usual.
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Insteon products for over 2 years in my house in Kuwait, Middle East. Kuwait city has UK electricity standards - 220 volts, therefore my Insteon product options are narrowed. However, I have not ever experienced any unlogical error or problem caused by these products. If there was one or two issues, they must've been due to my improper setup. This product, in particular, works as advertised. Installed it to dim 18 halogen spotlights and no issues experienced yet.
customer_reviews.author: Abdullah

customer_reviews.title: These works great, like most Insteon products
customer_reviews.text: These works great, like most Insteon products. You can program them using the hub and your mobile device or direct program them from device to device (no hub needed). To get Alexa functionality you will need the insteon hub.
customer_reviews.author: LividSquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Seems better than before
customer_reviews.text: Although instructions for integration with Alexa are hard to find, it does seem to work with Hub.
customer_reviews.author: C K

customer_reviews.title: Setup not easy without hub
customer_reviews.text: Once they're set up it's a breeze to use, but getting it setup can take a long time if you don't have the hub or similar product to program these. Trying to double tap that button to set the ramp speed is definitely among the most frustrating experiences if you have larger fingers. It's not impossible to set up without the hub, but it makes the process much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up for the first time or add ...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up for the first time or add to existing system. Consider the Insteon Hub for maximum features and control.
customer_reviews.author: Michael S Dutcher

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: These dimmers (Insteon 2477D) were part of my transition from X10 to Insteon. Over the years the X10 system went from "works 99% of the time" to "works sometimes" as I added powerline attached devices like phone chargers, computers, and TV's. Now that I am 100% Insteon the system functions flawlessly. Very happy. The only downside is the cost of the devices.
customer_reviews.author: James P. Jaster

customer_reviews.title: Bright!
customer_reviews.text: These are nice and work well with Alexa. They are also nice for a night light!
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: I love the switches, I've installed them throughout my entire house. It's amazing to be able to control the lighting in my home with my phone. I will be adding more Insta Jan products to my house now that the switches and controller have proven to be an great investment.
customer_reviews.author: faraz zaidi

customer_reviews.title: I love this switch
customer_reviews.text: I love this switch. Now I can turn off kitchen light after my wife leaves it on, all from the comfort of my chair. The switch was easy to install and setup on my iPhone was a breeze. This was my first remote switch to install. I am looking forward to installing others.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: CAUTION: This is not a 2-Wire Dimmable Switch
customer_reviews.text: I have bought 8 Insteon Dimmable Switches 2-Wire in packs of 4 each and they work great. Currently I need just one more switch to complete my project for the time being. I thought I would save a few bucks in odering from HighTek Electronics and recieved a 3-Wire switch instead. Now I have to return it and order another.
customer_reviews.author: Rjgroves

customer_reviews.title: Not much choice for older houses with only 2 wires (no ground wire).
customer_reviews.text: Not much choice for older houses with only 2 wires (no ground wire). No issues though, works well so far. The hub it uses disconnects often, so that is not fun, but it could be Alexa vs. the hub, as it happens with other skills/hubs as well.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetguy

customer_reviews.title: Great switch! Should come with a wall plate though.
customer_reviews.text: Great switch. Easily linked with my insteon hub. Just wish it came with a decor wall plate cause I was replacing a standard switch. Especially if we are paying $50 for a light switch. Luckily I had extras laying around so didnt need to make a trip to home depot...
customer_reviews.author: Ravig292

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: They look the same, dimmers and swtiches...I order bay accident the switches instead of the dimmers
customer_reviews.author: Lord Adam Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: As a professional electrician, I've been installing Insteon and X10 type components for decades. I wish I had a dime for every call back. When they work, they're wonderful. The problem is they don't last. after maybe 6 months or so, they start to act up and do weird things like turn on by themselves or not operate at all. Recently, I made the decision to stop installing all Insteon products for my customers and now I'm able to sleep with a clear conscience.
customer_reviews.author: Rustydog111

customer_reviews.title: Created a 3-way system from two different switched circuits - without a hub!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded some lighting and realized that two outdoor lights had no reason to be on two separate switches. So I was able to pair two of these switches together to function as a 3-way system - without any hub. Works perfectly! I also agree with previous comments that the LED display leads one to believe that this is a dimmer.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Best option for adding smart switches on the market
customer_reviews.text: Love these switches for adding virtual 3 ways. They work great, and link setup is easy between two or more switches. No central hub required. Now let's see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: pdizzle

customer_reviews.title: Love  the product, but quality is becoming an issue.
customer_reviews.text: While my whole house is Wired with Insteon, I have found the quality of their products decreasing. I had to buy this to replace a defective unit (out of warrenty) you would expect a no moving part unit to have better then a 2 year lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: Macgeek

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage. STAY AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve replaced 5 of these in the last 6 months. They don’t sync easily and start to malfunction in a few weeks/months. Customer service isn’t much help. After a lot of frustration with these switches, I decided to cut my losses and bough Lutron switches instead. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: leoblue

customer_reviews.title: Alexa Voice Controlled as well as Manual Switching
customer_reviews.text: Great switches - must remember to purchase the cover plate (sold separately). Fast acting On/Off single press. Press & Hold function dims the light(s) in stages pre-determined by you in the programming. Works great with Amazon Echo voice control.
customer_reviews.author: Gazza

customer_reviews.title: Works great, have several now and they always do what ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great, have several now and they always do what I want when I want. Oldest switch is over a year old and never misses a beat.
customer_reviews.author: MK

customer_reviews.title: Insteon simple
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of these switches. All work flawlessly. Much better than the old clunky X10 system. Insteon has been rock solid for us.
customer_reviews.author: railfan

customer_reviews.title: Smart On/Off Wall Switch
customer_reviews.text: Smart On/Off Wall Switch Works as it should, easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Boomer

customer_reviews.title: Had problems with these
customer_reviews.text: I've used these elsewhere in the house, but I've had problems with every one of the units I purchased in this batch from Amazon. They reset constantly, as if they're losing power; it seems to happen more in a dimmed state or when they're ramping on. Waited to long to install, so now I can't return through Amazon, but Smarthome is making good on them.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great smart dimmer
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. Very easy to install. If you have the hub then you can do a lot of customization. Works well with led dimmer. No led noise. Need a neutral wire.
customer_reviews.author: Merajur Rahman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: I now have my whole home wired with these dimmers. The setup is a bit time consuming, but now the echoes in my home are useful for so much more. I imagine the tech level is intermediate to advanced to really get the working, but then it's pretty easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Brooks Lindsey Family

customer_reviews.title: Incorrect product stocked
customer_reviews.text: This is advertised as the "dual band" switch, but multiple orders produced the older version which I had to return. Other Inseon products (dimmers, etc) have been fine through Amazon but for now direct orders from Smart Home are needed to get the "dual band switch" that works well with Alexa and the Hub.
customer_reviews.author: DAVIDN

customer_reviews.title: Love this set hub and switch is at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Great app easy setup and love it I'm about to add another switch to my house
customer_reviews.author: Desmond Allen

customer_reviews.title: These switches are really great for controlling built-in lighting
customer_reviews.text: These switches are really great for controlling built-in lighting. The switch design blends in seamlessly with existing switches and decor, and functions exactly as you'd expect. Beware of the size of these things, though. I had a lot of trouble fitting this into a tight box with a GFCI outlet next to it. I've seen some of the other reviews on here about reliability, and they have me worried but after a month, I've had no problems with connectivity or physical failure. These things just work quietly in the background.
customer_reviews.author: voigtek

customer_reviews.title: Great for home automation
customer_reviews.text: Love these switches. Haven't had any issues with them, though the instructions were a bit difficult to follow. Took a little figuring out but I got a pair of these wired up to a single set of lights in a 3-way configuration. Work with Alexa flawlessly as well. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: A. Swarvar

customer_reviews.title: Great switches
customer_reviews.text: I now have an entire house full of these switches and I absolutely love them. They've been in my basement for almost 3 years now and I have not had a single issue with any of them. In a 3-way setup you basically turn the circuit into a single switch setup, power the second switch and link it. Linking is super easy. Hold the button for 5 seconds, go to the switch you want to link it to and hold that switch for 5 seconds. Then do the same thing in reverse order and everything works together.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Reed

customer_reviews.title: good for alexa
customer_reviews.text: they work very will with the Alexa but not at all with the Google home with out adding more hub's to my already full router so not 100% happy with them would be much better if wi fi and not need a hub
customer_reviews.author: Robert Miller

product_meta.title: Insteon Smart On/Off Wall Switch, 1800 Watt, 2477S (White) - Insteon Hub required for voice control with Alexa & Google Assistant
product_meta.description: Color:White| Style:On/Off SwitchThe Insteon On/Off Switch is a remote controllable wall switch designed to operate a wide variety of lighting types for any non-dimming applications. The switch can be remotely turned on and off from any number of Insteon controllers such as a mini remote wireless switch (2342-242), wireless motion sensor (2844-222), wall switch keypads (2334-232), and even from other Insteon On/Off wall switches. You can also add the Insteon Hub (2245-222) to monitor, control, and configure from your smartphone or tablet. By adding the Insteon Hub you can also use Amazon Alexa and Microsoft Cortana to control the switch using your voice. The Insteon On/Off Switch requires a connection to Neutral. Rated for 17 Amp resistive capacity (100-277 VAC), 1,800 Watt incandescent capacity (100-277 VAC), 1 HP motors (at 120 VAC only), 10 Amps ballast.
feature_bullets: Remotely control any load type, such as fluorescent lights, fans, and motors
Powerful 1800 Watt capacity - Perfect for commercial and residential applications (100-277VAC)
2477S requires neutral wire - see model 2474DWH for no neutral wire required & model 2477D for dimmer switch
Wall plate NOT included - use Insteon Screwless Wall Plate (2422-222) for a professional finish
Works with Amazon Alexa & Google Assistant for voice control via required Insteon Hub (2245-222) + Doubles as Access Point for Insteon systems

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars892 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
